references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper is a foundational work demonstrating the superiority of diffusion models over GANs in image generation, which is the basis for many subsequent advancements in the field including this work.
This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a fundamental technique used in many diffusion models, including this work's underlying model.
This paper introduced the concept of consistency models which are the core of the methodology explored in this paper.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduced Stable Diffusion, a high-resolution text-to-image model which this paper uses as a starting point and improves upon.

references.paper_title: On density estimation with diffusion models
references.reason: This work provides a theoretical foundation for diffusion models, offering insight into the underlying mathematics of the process, crucial for many advancements in this field.
